item.description:
Hey all,

Reading two books for a meeting seemed to work out fairly well last month so we're going to do it again. In addition, with the holidays coming up, it made sense to schedule one meetup in December instead of trying to squeeze one in right around Thanksgiving and then again right around Christmas.

So we'll be meeting on Dec 15 at the Portland Pie Company on Elm Street in Manchester. This is a new pizza place that opened a few months ago. They're known for their unique and gourmet types of pizza. I've heard very good things about it and have been dying to try it.

So, on to the books we've chosen. We're doing one fiction, one non-fiction just like last time.

Our fiction pick is called Little Bee by Chris Cleave: a story of two women whose lives are intertwined with each other because of a fateful decision.

Our non-fiction book is Waiting for Superman, a series of essays that are meant to tie in with the new documentary of the same name. The documentary has generated a lot of buzz so I thought it would generate some really good discussions.

As before, you don't need to read both books to show up at the meeting, but you can if you wish.

12 person cap as usual and if you RSVP Yes and can't make it, please update your RSVP so another person can join us.

See you in December.

Jason

group.name: The Southern NH Books and Brew Club

item.name: A little pizza, a little beer, and two books. What more could you want?
